intro: Phanera ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty phanera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a reddish-brown coloration on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
